intro: Agapanthus inapertus, commonly known as the white agapanthus, is a striking perennial plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, upright stems that bear dense clusters of large, white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy inflorescences that are typically 15–30 cm in diameter, with petals that are often tinged with pale blue or purple. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Agapanthus inapertus is a popular ornamental plant, valued for its elegant appearance and ability to bloom reliably in gardens.
